name: Vegetable Jalfrezi
history: Vegetable Jalfrezi is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, originally derived from a type of Anglo-Indian food. The term 'Jalfrezi' refers to the stir-frying of ingredients, and the dish is known for its spicy, tangy tomato-based sauce with various vegetables.
description: Vegetable Jalfrezi is a vibrant and spicy stir-fry dish made with a mix of fresh vegetables such as bell peppers, carrots, and onions, cooked in a flavorful tomato-based sauce. It is often spiced with cumin, coriander, and turmeric, and finished with a squeeze of lemon juice.

instructions.title: SautÃ© the Aromatics
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan or wok. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. SautÃ© onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies until the onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Vegetables
instructions.description: Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Stir well. Add the chopped bell peppers, carrots, and green beans. Cook until they are slightly tender.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Cook
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil separates. The vegetables should be cooked but still retain some crunch.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and lemon juice over the curry. Mix well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve the Vegetable Jalfrezi hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: The vegetables should be cut uniformly for even cooking.
Adjust the spice levels according to your taste.
variations: Add paneer or tofu for a protein-rich version.
Include other vegetables like cauliflower or peas for more variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a colorful bowl to highlight the dish's vibrant appearance.
Pair with a side of cooling cucumber raita or a salad.
